title: Depth-First Search (DFS)
description: DFS explores as far as possible along each branch before backtracking. It can be implemented recursively or with a stack.
keyPoints: Can be implemented recursively or iteratively (with a stack).
Useful for exploring all nodes in a component.
Can be used for topological sort, cycle detection, etc.
pseudocode:
1. Mark the current node as visited.
2. For each unvisited neighbor, recursively call DFS.
3. Backtrack when all neighbors are visited.
